Structural building block of tissues: Particles less than 2.5 macrometres in diameter
Building block of all living things: Particles less than 2.5 milimetres in diameter

Structural building block of tissues: Particles less than 10 picometres in diameter
Building block of all living things: Particles less than 10 parts by million in diameter

Basic building block of all living thing: Structure composed of cells that perform the same task for the whole organism
Building block of all living things: Structure composed of identical cells that perform the same task

Basic building block of all living thing: Part of the body that performs a vital or special function
Structural building block of tissues: Part of the body that performs a special function
Building block of all living things: Part of the body that performs a vital function

Basic building block of all living thing: Something whose parts work together for the integrated whole, with high cooperation and low conflict
Building block of all living things: Cell or group of cells interconnected

What does 'cell' mean?: What's the difference between virus and virion?
Basic building block of all living thing: The term 'virus' refers to all phases of the virus infection cycle, whereas a virion refers to a virus particle
Structural building block of tissues: The term 'virus' refers to the initial virus, whereas a virion refers to all the virus particles created after replication
Building block of all living things: The term 'virus' refers to the virus particles smaller than 5 nanometres, whereas virion refers to virus particles bigger than 5 nanometres

Basic building block of all living thing: The English word 'virus' is based on a Latin word for 'poisonous secretion'
Structural building block of tissues: The English word 'virus' is based on a Greek word for 'poisonous secretion'
